verses.verse: O Lord<WH3068> God<WH410>, to whom vengeance<WH5360> belongs<WH410>; O God, to whom vengeance<WH5360> belongs<WH3313>, show yourself.
Lift up<WH5375> yourself<WH8199>, you judge of the earth<WH776>: render<WH7725> a reward<WH1576> to the proud<WH1343>.
Lord<WH3068>, how long shall the wicked<WH7563>, how long shall the wicked<WH7563> triumph<WH5937>?
How long shall they utter<WH5042> and speak<WH1696> hard things<WH6277>? and all the workers<WH6466> of iniquity<WH205> boast themselves<WH559>?
They break in pieces<WH1792> your people<WH5971>, O Lord<WH3068>, and afflict<WH6031> your heritage<WH5159>.
They kill<WH2026> the widow<WH490> and the stranger<WH1616>, and murder<WH7523> the fatherless<WH3490>.
Yet they say<WH559>, The Lord<WH3050> shall not see<WH7200>, neither shall the God<WH430> of Jacob<WH3290> regard it<WH995>.
Understand<WH995>, you brutish<WH1197> among the people<WH5971>: and you fools<WH3684>, when will you be wise<WH7919>?
He that planted<WH5193> the ear<WH241>, shall he not hear<WH8085>? he that formed<WH3335> the eye<WH5869>, shall he not see<WH5027>?
He that chastises<WH3256> the heathen<WH1471>, shall not he correct<WH3198>? he that teaches<WH3925> man<WH120> knowledge<WH1847>, shall not he know?
The Lord<WH3068> knows<WH3045> the thoughts<WH4284> of man<WH120>, that they are vanity<WH1892>.
Blessed<WH835> is the man<WH1397> whom you chasten<WH3256>, O Lord<WH3050>, and teach<WH3925> him out of your law<WH8451>;
That you may give him rest<WH8252> from the days<WH3117> of adversity<WH7451>, until the pit<WH7845> be dug<WH3738> for the wicked<WH7563>.
For the Lord<WH3068> will not cast off<WH5203> his people<WH5971>, neither will he forsake<WH5800> his inheritance<WH5159>.
But judgment<WH4941> shall return<WH7725> unto righteousness<WH6664>: and all the upright<WH3477> in heart<WH3820> shall follow it<WH310>.
Who will rise up<WH6965> for me against the evildoers<WH7489>? or who will stand up<WH3320> for me against the workers<WH6466> of iniquity<WH205>?
Unless<WH3884> the Lord<WH3068> had been my help<WH5833>, my soul<WH5315> had almost<WH4592> lived<WH7931> in silence<WH1745>.
When I said<WH559>, My foot<WH7272> slips<WH4131>; your mercy<WH2617>, O Lord<WH3068>, held me up<WH5582>.
In the multitude<WH7230> of my thoughts<WH8312> inside<WH7130> me your comforts<WH8575> delight<WH8173> my soul<WH5315>.
Shall the throne<WH3678> of iniquity<WH1942> have fellowship<WH2266> with you<WH3335>, which frames mischief<WH5999> by a law<WH2706>?
They gather themselves together<WH1413> against the soul<WH5315> of the righteous<WH6662>, and condemn<WH7561> the innocent<WH5355> blood<WH1818>.
But the Lord<WH3068> is my defense<WH4869>; and my God<WH430> is the rock<WH6697> of my refuge<WH4268>.
And he shall bring<WH7725> upon them their own iniquity<WH205>, and shall cut them off<WH6789> in their own wickedness<WH7451>; Yes<WH3068>, the Lord our God<WH430> shall cut them off<WH6789>.
